item.title: Winning the Culture War Through Christian Education ft. Kevin Swanson [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ July 13, 2024
In this conversation, Dr. Michael Thiessen interviews Kevin Swanson, the host of the Generations podcast, about the importance of homeschooling and family-based discipleship. They discuss the biblical foundation for homeschooling, the dangers of secular education, and the need for parents to take responsibility for their children's education. They also touch on the importance of the fear of God and the role of Christian classics in education. The conversation highlights the need for a return to a biblical worldview and a deeper understanding of the gospel. The conversation explores the fall of Western civilization and the potential for a revival. It discusses the impact of education on the fear and reverence of God, the breakdown of the family, and the division in the nation. The conversation also touches on the US presidential debate and the need for humility in America. It concludes with a discussion on the impending fall of civilization and the potential for a great awakening.

 

Chapters
00:00 Introduction and Sponsorship
00:59 Guest Introduction and Personal Testimony
07:41 The Biblical Model of Education and Family-Based Discipleship
10:45 The Importance of the Fear of God in Education
13:24 Emphasizing Christian Classics in Education
25:00 The Great Divide in the Evangelical Church
30:40 The Impact of Education on the Fear of God
32:06 The Breakdown of the Family and the Division in the Nation
34:01 The US Presidential Debate and the Fall of Western Civilization
38:07 The Need for Humility in America
41:22 The Impending Fall of Civilization and the Potential for a Great Awakening

item.title: More on the Nashville 10, American Summer Camp in Fujian, and a 4 Hour Email at a Chinese "Wangba" [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the China Compass Podcast! I start by sharing some observations from last week's Nashville Sentencing, which took place just after I recorded the interviews with Denny and Uncle Bundo. 

The most important thing I mention is Denny's bold declaration to the judge, which you can read here: https://chinacall.substack.com/p/missionary-arrested-in-nashville

Also, please bookmark Denny's extensive online used bookstore, which is one of the primary ways he supports his family and ministry: https://www.remnantbooks.org/

In my interview with Uncle Bundo, we forgot to encourage everyone to pray for Heather Idoni, one of the Nashville 10 (and a grandmother!) who is already in federal prison due to a similar conviction last year: https://freeheatheridoni.com/

The CCP is brought to you by Pray for China (https://prayforchina.us/) and today's province is Fujian on China's SE coast (paired up with South Carolina). 

After a short overview of Fujian, I discuss China's subtle propaganda at a Summer Camp FOR AMERICANS in China, hosted outside of Fujian's capital, Fuzhou: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2024/07/09/world/politics/xi-young-americans-scripted/

I also discuss China's CURRENT war with Taiwan, just miles away (in certain places) from Fujian: https://asiatimes.com/2024/06/chinas-war-with-taiwan-is-already-underway/

During story time, I tell about meeting a fighting couple (domestic abuse) and an elderly Christian man during the long walk through the old city streets of Fuzhou in 2003.

Finally, I finish by describing my attempt at pronouncing (and finding) "net bar" (wangba) in Fujian 20 years ago, and the time I spent four hours(!) writing an email to my now wife.

item.title: What Constitutes “Doing Good” in Politics and Public Policy [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: In his discussion of the ruler’s function, Peter tells persecuted Christians to “do good.” Is that limited to doing good deeds, or can his exhortation apply to how one does politics and drafts legislation? David says it includes the latter and gives real life examples from the last few years to demonstrate what the “good” is and isn’t in relation to a Biblical anthropology.

item.title: Ep. 114: Integrating Faith and Sports with Coach Gilliam [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
There are very few activities more unifying than sports. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by Patrick Gilliam, head coach of Wheaton College's women's soccer program, for a discussion about the genuine integration of faith and sport. Sports offer a unique training ground for the nurturing and cultivation of many beneficial life habits. Coach Gilliam shares his story of finding Christ through college athletics, how athletes can use their skills to glorify the Lord, and answers the question: Is it wrong for Christians to want to win? A team built around love, discipleship, and multiplication, is a team that glorifies God and lives out the two great commandments. Sports were intentionally designed by God, listen now to learn how they can bring God glory.

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. Published by ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Family Research Council⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠.

item.title: A Tale Of Two Presidents | Biden Vs. Bukele [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
What makes Buckle the leader that he is, while Biden seems to be slipping more every day?? 

It’s Prayer, praying for the civilians he vowed to serve, while Biden condones the murdering of hundreds of tiny civilians every day. 

You can either have this, or you can have that. You can have a leader like Bukele or you can have a leader like Biden. 

America needs to repent, and beg God to send them a judge like Gideon, a leader who will pray with his cabinet for his civilians.

item.title: Ep. 113: A Conversation with Gen Z [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
Understanding the perspectives of Gen Z is crucial to raising young disciples of Christ. Family Research Council interns Christian Pressler and Annabelle Pechmann join host Joseph Backholm to give their Gen Z perspective on topics ranging from social media to gym culture. The two weigh in on whether technology is helping or hurting their generation, why young girls are leaning towards the left and young men to the right, and the effects that pornography has had on their generation and relationships. The two share their own stories and struggles of being a Christian in Generation Z, along with how they have developed their own biblical worldview.

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. item.title: TCND: Family Improv, Birth Ball, and Carnivorous Cow Milk (Stuck-ulent) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
This is an absolute carnival of Branyan Family Improv.   That is to say, we're just shooting the breeze and telling stories...

Hear us talk about:

-Squeaky birthing balls and Lactation Chairs

-Why milk is bad in New Mexico

-What squirrels have in common with Jared Leto (spoilers: it's the way they talk)

-Tech issues and new equipment

-Fortunately/Unfortunately

-And finally: Our new family project idea!

 

Plus...  There's a succulent in the middle of the table. We probably better stop to talk about it.

Email the Comedian's family at nextdoor@johnbranyan.com

item.title: Science and Beauty: A Conversation with Ken Boa [The Pugcast]
item.description:
The Pugsters welcome back Dr. Ken Boa to talk about the importance of beauty for the Christian. Ken talks about seeing the beauty of the natural world and how we can use it as a force multiplier for our faith. This connects into a discussion of science and how it reveals the beauty in the world. The guys also talk with Ken about his upcoming events at the Museum of the Bible in Washington DC, and his Museum of Created Beauty app, both of which are designed to help Christians see and appreciate the wonders of creation and through that to enhance our worship.

 

Learn more about Reflections Ministries and Ken Boa at https://reflections.org

Find the Museum of Created Beauty app in your App Store or online at https://museumofcreatedbeauty.org/

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/

item.description:

The guys were joined by Dr. Grant, Jeff Durbin, David Fowler and Bradley Pierce to discuss the fallout of Roe being overturned. And, whether or not Christians would grow a backbone as a result.

item.title: 6 Months in Prison for Bible Smuggler, Baby Rescuer [China Compass]
item.description:
On this special episode of China Compass. I chat with my good friend "Uncle Bundo" the night before his sentencing in federal court for singing and praying in front of a Nashville abortion clinic.

After a brief introduction, we spend the first segment discussing his experiences during upwards of 30(!) trips to China, including taking Bibles to Chinese believers in the late 1980s (1:28).

Then, after discussing Uncle Bundo's favorite Chinese region (16:45), we talk through more stories, including being surrounded by Muslims in the middle of the night and falling and busting his head open in a Tibetan town (also in the middle of the night) with his teenage daughter driving the getaway-car-turned-ambulance.

(BTW, AsiaHarvest.org is the best way to send Bibles to China today. Also, visit PrayforChina.us to learn how to pray strategically for all of China.and follow @chinaadventures on X for daily China prayer updates)

We finish with Uncle Bundo sharing how you can be praying for him as he faces sentencing in Nashville  (41:15), followed by one last story about driving a retired police van turned Bible-delivery-vehicle all over the mountains of western China with his teenage kids.

Although he wants to keep his identity a secret, in hopes to return to China again one day, he does want to encourage everyone to pray for Heather Idoni, one of the Nashville 10 (and a grandmother!) who is already in federal prison due to a similar conviction earlier this year:

https://freeheatheridoni.com/

*Uncle Bundo was sentenced on July 3rd (the day AFTER this podcast was recorded) to 6 months in Federal Prison, followed by 6 months house arrest and three years of probation. The prison sentence won't start until at least October, possibly later depending on appeals.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Ep. 112: Independence Day with Rick Green pt. 2 [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
In the second part of our Independence Day series, host Joseph Backholm is joined again by Rick Green, the founder of Patriot Academy and former Texas State Representative. The two continue to unpack the current worldview of the United States, analyze government trends, and take a dive into who really is the threat to democracy. We are challenged to think like stewards of authority and remember that our rights come from God, not man.

Resources

    • ⁠Ep. 111: Independence Day with Rick Green pt.1⁠

item.title: 161: Pilgrims, July 4th & Joe Biden [Leadership Now Podcast]
item.description:
This 4th of July, Dr. Aaron Rock takes us through a bit of his family history and explains how is ancestors played a little role in the forming of the United States of America, and the significance of the Fourth of July.  He also shows what modern-day Canadian and Americans have to learn from those great men and women who have gone before us.

item.description:

The Riff sessions are comedy writing workshops. We're taking a premise and 'riffing' ideas with fellow comedians. Enjoy!

item.title: From Where Do Our Rights Come?: An Independence Day Special ft. Dan Ogden [The Ezra Institute Podcast for Cultural Reformation]
item.description:
In celebration of Canada Day (better known as Dominion Day) and the upcoming UK election, which happens to fall on July 4th, American Independence Day, Dr. Joe Boot is joined by Professor Daniel Ogden, Ezra Fellow for International Law, Comparative Politics, and International Relations, to discuss principles of political freedom, rights and responsibilities, good governance, and the rule of higher law.

Episode Resources:
Did America Have a Christian Founding?: https://amzn.to/4cNrZf7;
The Founders Key: https://amzn.to/3zuqFzu;
America on Trial: https://amzn.to/45PkPos;
Law without Nations?: https://amzn.to/4cqea6p;

Think biblically about politics with the help of Dr. Boot's latest book  "Ruler of Kings": https://ezrapress.ca/products/ruler-of-kings-toward-a-christian-vision-of-government;

Got Questions? Would you like to hear Dr. Boot answer your questions? Let us know in the comments or reach out to us at https://www.ezrainstitute.com/connect/contact/;

item.title: Timothy Brindle: New Record Drop: Fault Lines the Album [Dead Men Walking Podcast]
item.description:
This week Greg sat down with Timothy Brindle. Timothy Brindle is a Pastor in the PCA, Lecturer at Westminster Theological Seminary, and hip hop artist since 2003. We discussed the drop of his new album (6/24/24)  "Fault Lines: The Album", the influence Voddie Baucham's book had on it, as well as an inside look on how the album was written and recorded. They discussed his relationship with Wrath & Grace, and the most pressing issue facing the church today. Greg also asked Timothy submitted questions from the listeners about the PCA, and his relationship with Shai Linne. Timothy stuck around for a segment of "Fresh 10" and his answers might surprise you. Enjoy! 

Striving for Eternity Ministries: Discipleship, Theology, and Doctrine: Book Your Seminar Today!

item.title: How Do We Celebrate in a Dying Country? w/ Jason Whitlock [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Gabe is out of studio to support the Tenessee Ten (I Stand with The Ten), and is joined by Jason Whitlock as he calls in for today’s show. 

How can we celebrate a dying country? Can we in good coincidence celebrate freedom while men and women are being sentenced for singing Psalms at an abortion clinic??

item.title: Denny Deported from China (Multiple Times), Sentenced in Nashville [China Compass]
item.description:
Today on the China Compass Podcast I interviewed my good friend and China co-laborer Denny (aka, William Ekvall Simpson) the day before his sentencing in federal court on July 3, 2024, for singing and praying in front of a Nashville abortion clinic back in 2021.

We spend most of our time discussing our evangelistic adventures in China (7:18), including stories of being chased in the middle of the night with his teenage son and multiple arrests by the Commies (with his teenage daughters).

We also discuss Denny's favorite Chinese place (Summer River, Gansu) and missionary martyr (William Ekvall Simpson) who loaned Denny his name for a season so he could get back into China.

*Visit PrayforChina.us (@chinaadventures on X) to learn how to pray more strategically for all of China.*

We finish by discussing how to pray for Denny and the ten who were being sentenced in Nashville. (47:21)

*Thankfully, Denny was NOT given prison time* by the judge, even though he gave wonderfully bold testimony to the truth in his public statement just before she passed sentence:

https://chinacall.substack.com/p/missionary-arrested-in-nashville

*He was given six months of House Arrest, followed by three years of probation. It is unclear when this will begin, depending on appeals.

Please bookmark Denny's extensive online used bookstore, which is one of the primary ways he supports his family and ministry: https://www.remnantbooks.org/

Welcome to Remnant Books. Our specialty is quality new and used Christian books.  We're sure you'll find that special book whether you're looking for books regarding Church History, Homeschool curriculum, Theology, Evangelism, Missions, Apologetics, Creation/Evolution, Classics, Biographies, or rare, out-of-print Christian titles.

item.title: S1E13 - ¿Qué es el evangelio? [Madurando en Cristo]
item.description:
Descubre la esencia del evangelio en tres aspectos fundamentales: el poder de Dios para salvación (Romanos 1:16), la muerte y resurrección de Cristo (1 Corintios 15:3-4), y la necesidad de una respuesta de fe y arrepentimiento (Marcos 1:15). Aprende cómo este mensaje transformador puede impactar tu vida hoy. Explora el significado profundo del evangelio y cómo vivirlo diariamente.

 

www.MadurandoEnCristo.org
item.author: Edgar Nazario / Carlos Maysonet
item.itunes:author: Edgar Nazario / Carlos Maysonet

item.title: Ep. 111: Independence Day with Rick Green pt.1 [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
It is a privilege to be an American. To be a citizen given rights and freedoms that are protected by law. But what makes America so great? Host Joseph Backholm is joined by the founder of Patriot Academy and former Texas State Representative, Rick Green, for a constitutional coaching lesson. Joseph and Rick ask the question, “Is America worth saving?” – the short answer, is yes, absolutely. They dive into what makes America, America, if the Declaration and the Constitution are biblical, and how should Christians view the Constitution. Listen now to the first part of our Independence Day two-parter for a constitutionally-centered conversation!

Resources

  • ⁠Patriot Academy⁠

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. Published by ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Family Research Council⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠.

item.title: How to Win the World: Part 5: Practice Hospitality [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
Over our summer series "How to Win the World", P Nate and Pootie have the privilege to sit down with some amazing guests and discuss practical Christian commands that when faithfully obeyed push back darkness and cultivate Christian culture! Continue to join us as we learn how to put our hand to the plough in real tangible ways.

In this fourth episode the Rebels are joined by Author, Podcaster and all-round Christian influencer Rachel Jankovich to tackle the very important, often over-looked subject of Christian Hospitality!

item.title: TCND: City of Firsts, Kid Coffee, and Presidents with Dementia (Garage Sale Scams) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
HOW MANY BABIES ARE YOU PLANNING TO HAVE?!  Turns out, we've been fielding that question for over a decade...

Next: did you know the very first automobile was tested in our town of Kokomo, Indiana?  Well... that's because it's not actually true.  But Kokomo still loves to call itself the City of Firsts.  (And we really are responsible for that loveable Big, Red Dog!)

Still no McBaby... The Big Kids are drinking "coffee."  And John wants to talk about the Presidential Debate that he didn't watch.

Later: a shocking number of people can't figure out when they're talking to a robot...or when they're sharing photos of a "missing person" who is actually a plastic doll.  How does THAT affect the voting situation? 

Join us at the table, Neighbor!

item.title: C. S. Lewis, Writer and Philosopher: An Interview with Dr. Michael Ward [The Pugcast]
item.description:
The Pugs are still in Oxford, and today they're at the Kilns (Lewis's home) with their friend, Dr. Michael Ward, author of Planet Narnia and After Humanity: A Guide to C. S. Lewis's Abolition of Man. The conversation naturally cover's Dr. Ward's books. Join us for a conversation over tea at the Kilns as the Pugs speak with him about Narnia and the post-human dystopia Lewis predicted would follow a loss of objective value.

 

Connect with Dr. Ward and find his books at michaelward.net

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/
